poem:
### Silent Fridge

The fridge door yawns in silence,  
a hollow chamber of absence.  
Two jobs, yet the clatter of empty  
echoes louder than coins in pockets.  
Rent asks, hunger answers—  
a daily algebra of thin balance.  
In the land of plenty, humility arrives  
in the space between meals,  
where dreams simmer but never boil.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘You open the fridge – nothing’: renewed threat of US hunger as Trump seeks to cut food aid Jade Johnson has a word to describe the experience of going hungry in one of the world’s richest countries. “Humbling.” The last time she endured the misery of skipping meals was about 18 months ago. She was working two jobs as a home health aide and in childcare, but after paying the rent and bills she still". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
